II. Policy Order and Resolution List
1. POR 2025 #71 : That the City Manager is requested to meet with the leadership of the Harvard Square Business Association to discuss the proposal and to take the necessary steps to facilitate the release of $72,000 to fund the RFP development for the tunnel engineering study. Charter Right

EXERCISED BY COUNCILLOR AZEEM

Policy Order Printout
2. POR 2025 #72 : That the City Manager is requested to work with the School Department, the Department of Public Works, and other relevant departments to ensure that all city owned parking lots, with a focus on school complexes, including the still under construction parking at Tobin/Darby Vassal school complex, could be made available for after-hours use by residents. Order Adopted as Amended [Unanimous]
Policy Order Printout
a. Original POR 2025 72

III. Calendar
Charter Right
1. POR 2025 #68 : The City Manager is requested to confer with the Community Development Department to develop a timeline for the next Inclusionary Housing Study, explore remedies to address the lack of housing starts and provide for consideration draft amendments to the Inclusionary Housing Ordinance, and explore other incentives to encourage developers to include affordable units beyond the requirement voluntarily. Order Adopted as Amended by Substitution [Unanimous]
Policy Order Printout
a. Original POR 2025 68
2. POR 2025 #69 : That the City Manager is requested to include in the FY26 Operating Budget a continued commitment to Emergency Housing Vouchers for Permanent Supportive Housing and Mixed Status Families, and the Transition Wellness Center, as well as allocate the necessary resources to establish a municipal successor to Rise Up Cambridge that builds on its mission of providing direct, dignified economic support to families. Order Adopted as Amended by Substitution [Unanimous]
Policy Order Printout
a. Original POR 2025 69

VII. Communications and Reports from Other City Officers
1. COF 2025 #79 : A communication was received from Diane LeBlanc, City Clerk, transmitting an update regarding legislative activity. PLACED ON FILE [Unanimous]
Communication and Report from Other City Officers Printout
a. Updated Hearing Schedule 5.7.2025
b. PENDING HOME RULE PETITIONS MAY, 12, 2025
c. 2024-2025 Committee Referral List

2. COF 2025 #81 : A communication was received from Director of Housing, Chris Cotter, transmitting Inclusionary Housing Program - New Development related to Charter Right #1 regarding Inclusionary Housing. PLACED ON FILE [Unanimous]
Communication and Report from Other City Officers Printout
a. Inclusionary Housing Program New Development 5.12.2025
Appended Information
Awaiting Report Status Update
ARS-25-14 : Awaiting Report Status Update 05.12.25
a. Awaiting Report Status Update 05.12.25
Awaiting Report List
3. AR-24-64 : The City Manager is requested to work with relevant City departments to prepare a Home Rule Petition to enact legislation which would allow the City of Cambridge to prohibit associations from unreasonably restricting the use of a solar energy system.
4. AR-25-3 : The City Manager is requested to report back to the City Council with a update on the status and timeline for the completion of the Grand Junction Multiuse Path and how implementation between Gore Street and Little Binney could coincide with Phase 2 of the CSO implementation on Cambridge Street.
5. AR-25-5 : The City Manager is requested to work with relevant City departments to prepare a report on the use of M.G.L. Ch. 40U to determine which local statutes can be enforced by the local-option procedure in order to better collect fines in violation of Cambridge ordinances and provide a recommendation to the City Council for implementation of Ch. 40U procedures.
6. AR-25-11 : The City Manager is requested to exert all appropriate influence on EZ Ride and Passio to take immediate and concrete steps to fully resolve tracking deficiencies and improve real-time transit accuracy for riders.
7. AR-25-12 : The City Manager is requested to work with all appropriate Departments to develop language to create an “Affordable Rent Incentive Program” program for Cambridge and to report back to the City Council with option, including the percentage of possible tax abatements.
8. AR-25-15 : The City Manager is requested to work with relevant departments to create a plaque to be placed at the entrance of or inside City Hall that demonstrates the values that the Cambridge City Council upholds of the separation of church and state and gender equality.
9. AR-25-18 : The City Manager is requested to direct the appropriate City departments to draft language to create an Ordinance to insure that vacant store fronts and commercial properties keep their properties in safe and clean conditions.
10. AR-25-20 : That the City Manager is requested to confer with the Community Development Department to develop a timeline for the next Incentive Zoning Nexus Study.
11. AR-25-24 : That the City Manager is requested to work with relevant City departments to do more outreach to residents, businesses, and property owners to communicate the drought status and take all measures to reduce nonessential water use citywide, and provide a report on citywide water usage and water supply.
12. AR-25-25 : That the City Manager is requested to establish a Lost and Found program at Cambridge City Hall.
13. AR-25-26 : That the City Manager is requested to confer with the Community Development Department to assemble a list of public and private spaces available to the public, indoors and outdoors, noting contact information and any associated requirements, ensuring that there are public meeting places identified in each neighborhood.
14. AR-25-27 : That the City Manager investigate bike pod storage options to be placed in suitable areas in the City to provide residents and visitors safe storage options.
15. AR-25-28 : That the City Manager is requested to prepare an update with details on the status of potential civilian flagger operations in the Cambridge police union contract and work with relevant city staff to explore a civilian traffic flagger program and update the current police union contract on the City's website.
Adjournment
